enWisdom: Wisdoms are the gardens of the noble ones
Wisdom is a garden for the intelligent and a promenade for the noble

Wisdom: اسْتَشْعِرِ الْحِكْمَةَ وَتَجَلْبَبِ السَّكِينَةَ فَإِنَّهُمَا حِلْيَةُ الْأَبْرَارِ
enWisdom: Fill your heart with wisdom and don the attire of tranquillity for these two are the ornaments of the virtuous
Espouse wisdom, for indeed it is an exquisite ornament

Wisdom: كُلُّ شَيْ‏ءٍ يَمَلُّ مَا خَلَا طَرَائِفَ الْحِكَمِ
enWisdom: Everything leads to weariness except novel wisdom

Wisdom: مَنْ لَهِجَ بِالْحِكْمَةِ فَقَدْ شَرَّفَ نَفْسَهُ
enWisdom: One who attaches himself to wisdom has ennobled himself
From the treasures of the unseen comes forth wisdom
Thinking outside [the bounds of] wisdom is folly

Wisdom: لَا تَسْكُنُ الْحِكْمَةُ قَلْباً مَعَ شَهْوَةٍ
enWisdom: Wisdom does not reside in a heart [that is filled] with lust

Wisdom: إِنَّ كَلَامَ الْحَكِيمِ إِذَا كَانَ صَوَاباً كَانَ دَوَاءً وَإِذَا كَانَ خَطَأً كَانَ دَاءً
enWisdom: Indeed the speech of a wise person, when it is correct, is a cure and when it is wrong, is a malady
